title: Helena Bonham Carter on 'aunting' role as Princess Margaret in The Crown
text:
Helena has revealed she is nervous to take on the role (Picture: Getty Images/Netflix)

Helena Bonham Carter has revealed how ‘daunting’ it is to take on the role of Princess Margaret in Netflix’s The Crown.

The actress is taking over the role of Queen Elizabeth II’s younger sister from Vanessa Kirby for the show’s upcoming third season, and has admitted that she is nervous to be following in the Bafta winner’s footsteps.

Speaking at the Cheltenham Literature Festival, she said: ‘It’s daunting, definitely daunting. Vanessa has just won a Bafta and she’s brilliant, and in a way you have the ghost of the real Margaret and the ghost of the actress who played her.

‘You also have the fact everyone has an opinion about the woman and yet ultimately very few people knew what her private life was like and that’s the sort of the joy of the job.’

And while Helena stressed that the historical drama series is not intended to be a documentary, she hopes the public will be able to relate to the message behind the series, as she mentions she ‘does not look like’ Margaret.

‘I don’t look like her. You just hope you get something of an idiom and a blade or a scent of them and it transforms your inner landscape,’ she continued.

‘The Crown has been very, very compassionate to most of the members of the family and has been very positive.

‘A lot of it is true and there is a whole floor of researchers.’

Helena is taking over the role from Vanessa Kirby (Picture: Netflix)

The 53–year-old also believes that Margaret was ‘vulnerable’, and misinterpreted by many.

She added: ‘I think Margaret was very much her [Queen Elizabeth II] father’s daughter. She had the anxiety he had, and I think a lot of people interpreted her as angry, rude and tough.

‘She wasn’t tough at all, and I think she was quite vulnerable and often attack was the best form of defence.’

Alongside Helena, Olivia Colman will be joining the cast to take over the role of Queen Elizabeth II, following on from Claire Foy, while Tobias Menzies will portray Prince Phillip, after Matt Smith played him during the first two seasons.

Season three of The Crown will be released to Netflix on 17 November.
